sentences: Jonathan Monroe Craig (born March 26, 1986) is a Canadian-American singer and songwriter, best known as the former lead vocalist of bands Dance Gavin Dance, Emarosa, and Slaves, as well as the co-lead vocalist of the short-lived supergroup Isles & Glaciers.

sentences: Isles & Glaciers (2008–2010)
On December 15, 2008, Alternative Press officially announced and revealed the name and lineup of this new project, Isles & Glaciers.
The band's first EP, The Hearts of Lonely People, was produced by Casey Bates in Seattle, Washington, was reworked in April 2009 in Michigan and was released March 9, 2010.
The band's first EP, The Hearts of Lonely People, was produced by Casey Bates in Seattle, Washington, was reworked in April 2009 in Michigan and was released March 9, 2010.
A tweet reading in part "...and people wonder why we won't do another I & G record." was sent out by Craig Owens in 2011, as the MacBook scandal was breaking.
Solo work (2009–2014)
Jonny Craig released his debut solo album A Dream Is a Question You Don't Know How to Answer on August 18, 2009, through Rise Records.
For promotional purposes he took press photos for the release in late 2009 with photographer Gage Young in Orlando, Florida.

Craig announced on January 16, 2011 that he would be taking an indefinite hiatus to "pursue the filming of his documentary", stating that all his currently planned records and tours would be canceled.
On January 21, 2011, Craig announced that he would not actually be taking this hiatus, stating: "hate me all you want people I love what i do and im great at it.
Craig was featured in Alternative Press's issue #288 that was released June 5, 2012.
In November 2012, somebody hacked Craig's personal e-mail that contained some demos that circulated on the internet; Craig stated the leaked material will not be on his upcoming solo EP.
He released his solo EP, Find What You Love and Let It Kill You, on September 24, 2013, as an independent release.
On November 26, 2013 Jonny has released the Special Edition of Find What You Love
He has also released a new song, "Dirty Christmas" which is available also on November 26, 2013.
The band have released their debut album in the summer of 2014 via Artery.
We Are All Equals, was released June 24, 2014 via Artery Recordings.
Its lead single "The Fire Down Below" premiered April 22, 2014.
In early 2015, Craig released the albums The Blueprint For Going In Circles, in collaboration with singer-songwriter Kyle Lucas, and The Le Cube Sessions, respectively.
In 2017, Slaves released a new single entitled "I'd Rather See Your Star Explode" along with an accompanying music video.
The group's third studio album, Beautiful Death was released on February 16, 2018.
An acoustic EP called "Revision" was released on January 18, 2019.
”Currently, Jonny Craig remains a solo artist, with his second and most recent solo album release being "The Places We'll Never Be" on September 10, 2021.
In February 2011, several of Craig's fans accused him of being involved in an internet scam.

sentences: In 2015, Slaves were kicked off the Warped Tour after Craig sexually harassed a female merchandise worker.

In 2017, numerous women accused Craig of sexual assault and rape, which led to Slaves being dropped from their record label, Artery Recordings, shortly before the scheduled release of their third album Beautiful Death.
In 2019, Craig was accused of sexual assault and domestic violence from his ex-girlfriend, Taylor Nicole Dean, in a lengthy video posted to her YouTube channel.

Jonny is also father to his son, Storm Parker-Monroe Craig, his first child with current fiancée Sydney England "Syd", as they revealed their pregnancy on March 27, 2020 and announced their son's birth on July 13 2020.
The couple announced their engagement on September 3, 2020 on his Instagram, and he's since been filmed possibly proposing a second time to her during his tour.
